text: Chui Ka is one of the 38 constituencies in the Sha Tin District in Hong Kong. The constituency returns one district councillor to the Sha Tin District Council, with an election every four years. Initially created as Sun Chui in 1991, the current Chui Ka constituency is loosely based on Sun Chui Estate and the area around the Tai Wai Station, with an estimated population of 18,417. ==Councillors represented== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1991 | rowspan=2| William Wai Hing-cheung | HKAS |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | Democratic |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | rowspan=2| Lee Kam-ming | Civil Force |- |style="background-color: " | | 2014 | Independent |- |style="background-color: " | | 2015 | rowspan=2| Li Sai-hung | Neo Democrats |- |style="background-color: " | | 2019 | Independent democrat |} ==Election results== ===2010s=== ===2000s=== ===1990s=== ==References== Category:Tai Wai Category:Constituencies of Hong Kong Category:Constituencies of Sha Tin District Council Category:1991 establishments in Hong Kong Category:Constituencies established in 1991
title: Chui Ka (constituency)
